text: Everett Lamar "Rocky" Bridges (August 7, 1927 - January 27, 2015) was an American baseball utility infielder. He played in Major League Baseball from 1951 to 1961. He played for the Brooklyn Dodgers, Cincinnati Reds, and St. Louis Cardinals of the National League. He also played for the Washington Senators, Detroit Tigers, Cleveland Indians, and Los Angeles Angels of the American League. Bridges was born in Refugio, Texas. He was married to Mary who died in 2008 and had four children. Bridges died on January 27, 2015 in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, aged 87. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1927 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American baseball players Category:American League All-Stars Category:Brooklyn Dodgers players Category:Cincinnati Reds players Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players
title: Rocky Bridges
